In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution for your problem using Julia programming language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [Dates.format(d, "yyyyMM") for d in df[:dt]]
    return df
end
```
This function takes a `DataFrame` as input and creates a new column `ym` by extracting the year and month from each DateTime value in the `dt` column. The `Dates.format()` function is used to format the date time values into the desired "yyyyMM" format, where "yyyy" stands for the 4-digit year and "MM" stands for the 2-digit month.

Please note that you should have DataFrames package installed in your Julia environment to run this code successfully. If it is not installed yet, you can add it using `Pkg.add("DataFrames")`.
